definition: Zhaozhou Bridge over Xiao River 洨河[Xiao2 He2] in Zhao county 趙縣|赵县[Zhao4 Xian4], Shijiazhuang, Hebei, dating back to the Sui dynasty 隋代[Sui2 dai4] (581-617) and the world's oldest extant stone arch bridge
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
prefecture/(old) province/(old) administrative division/state (e.g. of US)/oblast (Russia)/canton (Switzerland)
bridge/CL:座[zuo4]

sentences.english: The most famous one is the Zhaozhou Bridge in Zhao County, Hebei Province"."
sentences.chinese: 其中最着名的当推河北省赵县的赵州桥”。

sentences.english: The Zhaozhou Bridge is a precious cultural heritage that the ancient Chinese artisans and engineers left as a legacy.
sentences.chinese: 赵州桥是我国古代劳动人民留下的珍贵文化遗产。

sentences.english: Zhaozhou bridge is the oldest stone - arch bridge in the world.
sentences.chinese: 赵州桥是世界上最古老的石拱桥。

sentences.english: The Zhaozhou Bridge Park has Zhaozhou Bridge as its center and gateway.
sentences.chinese: 赵州桥公园以赵州桥为中心而建的。

sentences.english: The Zhaozhou Bridge Park has Zhaozhou Bridge as its center and gateway.
sentences.chinese: 赵州桥公园以赵州桥为中心而建的。
